Event Venues | Fun Places for Private Events | FloridaRAMA top of page Home Visit Tickets Hours/Pricing FAQ Directions Accessibility Immersive Games Gallery Insiders Club Immersive Dates Tourism Families Events Upcoming Events Private Events Weddings Kids pARTy Package Corporate Groups Groups Field Trips Book Now! Memberships About Accessibility Artists Team News Blog Careers Partnerships Sponsorships Contact Media Inquiries Sponsorships Shop Get Tickets! More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Private Events at Experience Tampa Bay's Most Unique & Memorable Events Venue Inquire Now Weddings kids Birthdays Looking for an extraordinary experience, creative and fun destination to host an event in St. Petersburg? FloridaRAMA is not your typical museum – it’s an immersive art experience blending contemporary art, digital interactions, retro Florida, and good vibes Art for All, Play for All, Joy for All Venue Highlights: Accommodates up to 500 guests Private areas available for smaller groups and meetings Brag-worthy events include: Corporate dinners Weddings Bat/Bar mitzvahs Holiday parties Social gatherings Fundraisers Team building Full-Service Event Planning: Inclusive packages with creative design, catering, bar services, entertainment, team building, A/V, scavenger games, and décor Partnership with top local vendors for meticulous detail and seamless execution Our Promise: Experienced and caring team to perfect your special occasion If you can imagine it, we can create it Inquire Now Rental Spaces FloridaRAMA Full Experience 15,000 sq ft created in collaboration with 80+ artists using a variety of media including design, video, sound, light, sculpture and painting. FloridaRAMA is an extraordinary world celebrating all things Florida. Reception (500) Sit Down (275) Mermaid Star Motel Pool A 1950-1960s style roadside Florida motel. The motel is near open space, including a river of grass and freshwater springs. The Mermaid Star’s spring-fed swimming pool has magic water with special restorative powers. Reception (50) Sit Down (30) The p ART y Room Originally a science lab work space, now changed into an imaginative private room. The perfect space for networking events, rehearsal dinners, children’s parties, boardroom meetings, craft classroom, book club and more. The room can be used on its own or will access to the FloridaRAMA experience. ​ Reception (45) Sit Down (35) Inquire Now Event Rental FAQ ​ ​Is FloridaRAMA open during an event? A FloridaRAMA buyout offers a complete private event throughout the entire experience. The Mermaid Star Motel Pool is a semi-private area and reserved for an event with the rest of the FloridaRAMA experience open for visitors. The pARTy room is a private room alongside the experience. Do you provide event planning services? Yes, we offer event coordination and planning services to help you organize every detail, including décor, entertainment, catering and swag. Ask about our packages! Is there parking available? Yes, we have ample free parking on-site. We also offer valet services for larger events. Public transport options are nearby for added convenience. Can we bring our own food or caterer? We partner with our approved preferred caterers to assist with menu services. Ask our events team for further details. Do you offer bar services? Yes, we offer beer & wine packages to top-shelf full bar services and everything in between, including custom drink packages. We can accommodate specific requests. No outside beverages are permitted. ​ Is your venue accessible for guests with disabilities? Yes, our venue is fully ADAA accessible, including ramps and accessible restrooms. What clients are saying: "No better fun and inspiring venue in the St. Pete area to throw a party. My 50th birthday was a blast!! I loved how the events team took care of everything." - Kathy B. Nov 2024 "Just a wonderful space for an amazing party.  We had the best time! Every detail was perfect and memorable." - Rachel W. Feb 2025 "After being in meetings all day, I was looking forward to a fun unique space to unwind and mingle with my team. FloridaRAMA was a great choice for a creative and comfortable venue for my company's off site dinner." - Matt S. March 2025 Connect With Our Events Team— Let's Connect! Phone 727-201-2577 Email events@floridarama.art © 2025 FloridaRAMA bottom of page

Contact Us (U.S. National Park Service) An official website of the United States government Here's how you know Here's how you know Official websites use .gov A .gov website belongs to an official government
organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock ( Lock Locked padlock icon ) or https:// means you've safely connected to
the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official,
secure websites. Work by five new artists added to the FloridaRAMA experience • St Pete Catalyst ST Pete's Business Daily (and a whole lot more) sign up for a free lifetime subscription And take your seat at the table Name Email Subscribe News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Connect with us Type a text St Pete Catalyst News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Create Work by five new artists added to the FloridaRAMA experience Published 4 months ago on May 17, 2025 By Bill DeYoung Robot J19 is a small-scale diorama by Mike Norton. Since its debut in September 2021, the only constant at the immersive, walk-through art experience FloridaRAMA has been change. Rather than a static gallery or museum of art, FloridaRAMA is its own world of whimsy, where nothing is as it seems – and nothing is as it was even a year or two ago. From major, room-sized additions to small and almost imperceptible upgrades, “We’re adding something almost daily,” CEO Liz Dimmitt said. “I’m a maximalist, and I want more and more layers. That’s what I think we’re all going for here.” Just this week, works by five new artists, all of them Floridians, have been added to the mix at the FloridaRAMA funhouse. Vortex Veritas by Nicole Salgar. Nicole Salgar has installed Vortex Veritas , a small room, pulsating with lights and music, through which visitors must pass to enter the topsy-turvy universe Dimmitt and her team of creatives have constructed. The name translates as “truth portal,” and it’s an invitation to visitors to leave their own “truths” behind as they stroll into the art-and-technology alt-Florida, where all senses are engaged in a sort of carnival ride, using lights, video, color, music and even programmed aromas. “The truth portal,” Dimmitt insisted, “is your adjustment from there to here.” Past the neon lobby of the Mermaid Star Motel (with its interactive guest rooms) and the motel pool (on the ceiling) is Salgar’s second installation, Cabana Confessional . These are changing cabanas that double as, well, curtained confessionals. There are surprises inside. “ Cabana Confessional is that perfect tongue-in-cheek, fun, contemplative, smart example of that high-low phenomenon we’re going for over and over again,” Dimmitt explained. There is no right or wrong way to commit to the FloridaRAMA experience, she insisted, and no set timeline. Many visitors will walk through first as an overview, to take it all in, then slow down to investigate each room’s myriad smaller details. Lamp by Guy Williams. Also new are six new steampunk lamps by artist Guy Williams , each made from found materials and switched on to do unusual things with light. These are now part of the “cabinet of curiosities” in Rae’s Lampscape Room , along with miniature robot assemblages made with “brass, scrap metal, and personality” by artist Mike Norton . Said Dimmitt: “We’re always trying to be new, fresh, relevant, but we like to say our aesthetic is ‘retro futuristic.’ That Jetsons -type thing, like what people in the past imagined the future to be like.” iBOMS, “Joy For All.” Nearby is a digital “diorama bench” by artist Type_n (aka (Tyler Norman), fusing natural forms with dreamlike, tech-infused aesthetics, and a two-headed alligator sculpture ( Mythological Guardians ) by the artist Dolios . In 2024, Jabari Reed-Diop (also known as iBOMs ) contributed a series of distinctive glowing and iridescent wall images, using his trademark cartoon characters in a series of wildlife encounters. His installation is called Joy For All. FloridaRAMA does have a narrative storyline, Dimmitt explained, tying in the centrally-located retro-motel and its fictional owners, astrophysicist and inventor Rae Current and his retired mermaid wife, Pearl. There are “guides,” known as “pink vesters,” roaming the spaces. “They don’t work for FloridaRAMA; they’re employees of the Mermaid Star Motel,” Dimmitt said. “Some of them are very performative and into the whole thing, while others might not be as much. So they embrace it as much as they want to.” Visitors will recognize patterns in the artwork, and can pick up clues along the way as to how Rae and Pearl designed and intended FloridaRAMA – but it isn’t necessary. It’s all part of the “choose your own” experience. “It seems like there’s so much going on around you, but there are intentional elements either repeated over and over again, or placed in your path in a certain pattern that makes them more monumental.” Sometimes just wandering around is its own reward. Palehorse, “Temple of Cosmic Balance.” “A lot of things are triggered by your movement; they’re only appearing because you’re there,” Dimmitt explained. “Others are there to encourage people to be hands-on, to be playful and have fun in the space. And there are QR codes in every area, so that if you’re interested it tells you about every artist and every artwork. “So there is didactic information available, but the narrative, we’re learning over time how to share it, in an in-world way that doesn’t just have a bunch of signs and descriptions everywhere. And we like to do that in a really playful way.” Another recent addition: The Pirate Ship Ball Pit (yes, you can climb in). FloridaRAMA in recent years has added scavenger hunts and games, for different ages. Also new is a “members lounge,” to be utilized for birthday parties, art salons and other events. Coming May 24 is “Day of Play,” a family festival in collaboration with Sunshine City With Kids. Find info here . Four years into their big adventure, Dimmitt and the FloridaRAMA creative team continue to monitor visitor preferences to “see what works.” Remaining open to new ideas – to change – is paramount. Always there, however, is the commitment to build up their immersive world with the work of local artists. “Since we’re not a theme park or a movie set, we have all these artists who we’ve partnered with, who we’ve commissioned to have their art here,” Dimmitt said. “We also want to give their art individual moments, and be part of a whole experience.” FloridaRAMA website . FloridaRAMA is designed for comfort, clarity, and inclusion, so guests of all ages and abilities can explore with confidence.

Core access at a glance:
• Step-free routes and ramps
• Wide pathways with seating clusters
• Staff support for wayfinding and pacing

We also provide sensory-friendly options: quieter time blocks, low-sensory route suggestions, sensory bags at the front desk, and quiet spaces for breaks. Interactives are approachable too, tactile elements, clear signage, and hidden games that work great for cooperative play.

Arriving is straightforward with accessible parking and a signed curbside drop-off. Share your needs ahead of time and we’ll tailor recommendations.

We’ve mapped the top experiences, great for families, date nights, and team outings:

If you’re mapping a first visit or rediscovering FloridaRAMA, Katelyn’s must-see list is a smart way to find the installations that define our space: inventive, playful, and deeply rooted in Florida stories.

Her favorites span the kinetic engineering of The Bait Ball, the theatricality of Shrimpfinity, the intimate storytelling of our RAMA Dioramas, the contemporary spectacle of Flora-Da-Scope, and the quiet immersion of Mermaid Star Motel & Everglades Arena. A bonus pick, Sugar Coat Disco, invites close looking and delight with its hidden “magical spoon.”

These works illustrate what FloridaRAMA does best: connect guests to local artists through immersive design, interactive narrative, and unforgettable visuals.

All Posts Search How to Make an Abstract Collage! juliec18 Jun 17, 2024 2 min read Have fun, expand your art-making practice and spark your curiosity as you follow along with our Education Manager, Liv Scully, in making a weird, wacky, wonderful collage! Here, we show you how to create something new with materials and tools that you may already have at home. If you’re local to Tampa Bay and would like collage materials, contact us at education@fairgrounds.art and say “Yes! I’d like a FREE collage kit!” and we can coordinate so you can pick up your free collage making kit (*this free kit is one-per person and only available until April 9th, or until supplies last!) At Fairgrounds St. Pete, education is about opening a world of possibilities. We want to inspire YOU to expand your repertoire of what you know and can do! To get started, you’ll need: Something sticky – like glue or tape! Scissors or an x-acto knife Collage materials, i.e. books, magazines, or photographs A piece of paper, used cardboard box, canvas, or a sketchbook! Optional: download and print your own Fairgrounds coloring sheet here to use our characters in your collage! WATCH THE VIDEO OR FOLLOW ALONG WITH THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW! To get started, gather your materials and set up your space. A big part of the creative process is giving yourself room to grow your practice! It doesn’t need to be fancy, or even all that big: some counter space, or a cleared off desk is a great place to start. Throw on your favorite music or podcast to set the tone of the space and for an added boost of inspiration! Spend some time with your collage materials: go through and take note of anything that sparks your curiosity! Pay attention to textures and colors that pop out at you! Take a look around your space to see if you have anything you already love that you could use to add to your work! To set the tone of your collage, try to find or create something to use as a background! You could layer multiple images, draw or paint a shape, add on top of something that already exists or just leave it blank! When you find some elements you like, play around with the composition! The composition is how the elements of art interact with each other. Try turning your collage from horizontal to vertical, and moving around different elements before starting to glue! Use your collage materials to layer images, fill up the space and manipulate the background.  There is no wrong way to collage! Once you’ve got your elements where you want them, go ahead and start to glue the individual pieces down, starting with the background! Get creative with your placement and gluing – it’s okay to extend off the canvas and layer pieces to highlight different parts of the composition. Pro-tip: if using liquid glue, try to use as little as possible! Too much glue can cause paper to wrinkle. Voila! A weird, wacky, wonderful collage. Now, to find a place to display your masterpiece! Immersive art experience in St. Petersburg is now called FloridaRAMA | FOX 13 Tampa Bay News Weather Sports Good Day We Live Here Contests More Watch Live Expand / Collapse search ☰ Search site News Top Stories Local Tampa Bay News Florida Tonight National FOX 13 Investigates Consumer Health Politics Seen on TV Daily Newsletter FOX News Sunday Rhythm Roots Weather SkyTower Radar Views Interactive Radar Live Webcams Marine Weather Weather Alerts Hurricane Safety Tracking the Tropics MyFoxHurricane FOX Weather Sports Buccaneers Rays Lightning No Off Days with Scott Smith Weekly Fishing Report High School Sports Good Day Traffic Charley's World Hometown Heroes Extraordinary Ordinaries Recipes First Birthdays We Live Here What's Right Dinner DeeAs One Tank Trips Theme Parks Made in Tampa Bay Recipes, Food & Drink Tampa Bay History Care Force Watch Live How To Stream Live FOX 13 Newscasts LiveNOW from FOX FOX Weather FOX Soul FOX Live Feed Central NASA TV Money Consumer Personal Finance The Economy Small Business Entertainment Headlines Trending Stories FOX Shows What's on FOX 13 Contests Tampa Bay Reads Regional News Orlando News - FOX 35 Orlando Gainesville News - FOX 51 Gainesville Atlanta News - FOX 5 Atlanta About Us Meet the FOX 13 team TV Listings Jobs & Internships WTVT History Closed Captioning FCC Public File FCC Applications Contact Us Immersive art experience in St. Petersburg is now called FloridaRAMA By Lloyd Sowers Published June 3, 2024 4:37pm EDT St. Petersburg FOX 13 News Share Copy Link Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit Fairgrounds St. Pete gets new name amid growth Fairgrounds St. Pete is expanding, adding a café and a bar. With its growth comes a new name: FloridaRAMA. ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. - The unique arts destination known as Fairgrounds St. Pete will now be called FloridaRAMA. "With technology and our phones, we sort of have multimedia things going all the time. It's a really fun way to bring art into that arena," said Liz Dimmitt, CEO and Co-Founder. "We really focus on celebrating weird whacky wonderful Florida, so we mean the people, the history, the art, the animals." Along with the name change, the attraction, which opened in 2021, will expand with a café and bar. Dimmitt expects increased attendance as the local art scene grows and synergy between local galleries increases. "They sort of give it its soul and personality, St. Pete in particular has been incredibly smart about cultivating the arts," shared Dimmitt. READ: Japanese culture in Clearwater at Kitsune Sushi FloridaRAMA, at 2606 Fairfield Ave. S. in St. Pete's Warehouse Arts District, displays the work of more than 75 artists in an immersive, dramatic, high-tech way with sight, sound, and even smell. Dimmitt said event space is available for parties and other special occasions and there are no limits on what kind of art can be presented in new ways. "Just this month we're going to partner with American Stage to have our first ever live theater performance inside the experience," she said. According to Dimmitt, FloirdaRAMA is retro-futuristic. If George Jetson and Florida Man partnered to open an art gallery, this would be it. For more information, click here . About FloridaRAMA Cooler than a museum, smarter than a theme park, and weirder than a carnival, FloridaRAMA is an immersive art experience located in St. Pete’s Warehouse Arts District. FloridaRAMA features a ticketed, interactive journey through a world created by 80+ artists—most of them local—that celebrates the weird, wacky and wonderful stories of Florida. ​ Part contemporary art museum, part digital playground, part Florida roadside attraction and part escape room, FloridaRAMA blends sound, light, sculpture, scent and storytelling into a vibrant, hands-on experience that invites guests of all ages to explore, touch and play. Unlike traditional museums, FloridaRAMA is made to be inhabited—bringing original Florida stories to life through immersive installations that reward curiosity and spark imagination. ​ Visiting or new to the area? Immerse yourself in the sights, sounds and smells (strawberry, pine, citrus!) of Florida. Locals will find new surprises with every visit—there’s always something fresh to discover at FloridaRAMA. ​ Beyond the immersive experience, guests can enjoy a robust calendar of events , a vibrant shop and snack bar and a free art gallery showcasing work from local and regional artists. ​ Looking for a one-of-a-kind venue? FloridaRAMA also serves as Tampa Bay’s most unique event space, ideal for private gatherings, social celebrations and corporate outings alike. ​ Send us an email ! ​ ​ Our Location FloridaRAMA is located in St. Pete's Warehouse Arts District, along the Pinellas Bike Trail. 2606 Fairfield Ave S., St. Pete, FL 33712 FloridaRAMA Experience Escape Reality Inside an Artist-Made World! Inside the FloridaRAMA Experience, guests explore a extraordinary world created in collaboration with 75+ local and international artists, featuring playful installations celebrating weird, wacky, wonderful Florida.​ Find clues to a mysterious narrative and gamify your experience by adding on an immersive scavenger hunt. The FloridaRAMA Experience is perfect for date night or a day of family fun! Get Tickets Venue Rental Spaces Plan an Unforgettable Event! Whether you're planning meetings, team-building activities, weddings, galas or any other special occasion, our versatile venue has the spaces and services to provide the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable event. Elevate your event to new heights with FloridaRAMA's exceptional amenities and unique space options. Learn More FloridaRAMA Gallery New Gallery Shows Every Month! The FloridaRAMA gallery features uniquely curated selling exhibitions by local and national artists each month.The gallery is free to visit and offers visitors and collectors the opportunity to view and collect work by local artists. Located by the FloridaRAMA cafe and ticketing desk, the gallery is open daily.
